newsitem.title: USA: Halsey to sell certain assets for $15 million.
newsitem.headline: Halsey to sell certain assets for $15 million.

text.p: Halsey Drug Co. Inc. said Friday it has a non-binding agreement with a generic drug maker to sell two of its subsidiaries in Indiana, including a manufacturing facility, and other assets for $15 million.

The deal is part of a broader marketing alliance between the companies and a proposed tender offer by the unidentified generic drug maker for 2.8 million, or about 19 percent of Halsey's outstanding shares, at $6 apiece.
Under the alliance, the generic drug maker will acquire marketing and distribution rights to certain Halsey products, Halsey said.
The sale also calls for Halsey to repay $3 million in outstanding promissory notes issued in favour of the purchaser.
The deal came about three weeks after Halsey reported first-quarter losses of more than $3.1 million, or 24 cents per share.
Halsey's stock rose $1.06 to $5 on the American Stock Exchange shortly before at midday.
